result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mantrell Teon Williams

records.addlTxt:
Final pre-trial on January 13, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 26, 2023 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Mantrell Teon Williams in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Mantrell Teon Williams. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Confirmed for trial. Defendant just received global offer. Speedy demand is withdrawn. Victim is present and if not resolved today wishes trial to proceed. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

3:09 PM (64-06) Defendant Mantrell Teon Williams in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Mantrell Teon Williams.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

Attorney Lochowicz acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.



Adj. 3:14PM
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Mantrell Teon Williams in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Mantrell Teon Williams.  Vivien TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed. Prelimiunary Hearing requested and time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mantrell Teon Williams not in court.  Attorney Keith Venema appeared for Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Mantrell Teon Williams. Warrant to Issue. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

2:00 PM - (64-06) Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mantrell Teon Williams appeared in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Kim appeared in court, specially.
Attorney Kim makes a record that an attorney has not been appointed to Mr. Williams yet, and is requesting more time to appoint an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF150, 20CF434, 20CT369 & 21CF477
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.J.A. OR L.M.R.S. NO CONTACT WITH K.R.B. OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-693 & 22-694

Defendant Mantrell Williams appeared in court, in custody by video with attorney Jenna Proudfit. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SPD will need to appoint due to conflict. Minutes filed.
